dn14:1.1.3.pli: Atha kho sambahulānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantānaṁ karerimaṇḍalamāḷe sannisinnānaṁ sannipatitānaṁ pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttā dhammī kathā udapādi:
dn14:1.1.3.en: Then after the meal, on return from alms-round, several senior mendicants sat together in the pavilion by the kari tree and this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk on the subject of past lives came up among them,

dn14:1.3.1.pli: “Iccheyyātha no tumhe, bhikkhave, pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ sotun”ti?
dn14:1.3.1.en: “Would you like to hear a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk on the subject of past lives?”

dn14:1.3.3.pli: yaṁ bhagavā pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ kareyya, bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī”ti.
dn14:1.3.3.en: Let the Buddha give a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk on the subject of past lives. The mendicants will listen and remember it.”

dn14:1.15.5.pli: Iccheyyātha no tumhe, bhikkhave, bhiyyoso mattāya pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ sotun”ti?
dn14:1.15.5.en: Would you like to hear a further [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk on the subject of past lives?”

dn14:1.15.7.pli: yaṁ bhagavā bhiyyoso mattāya pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ kareyya, bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī”ti.
dn14:1.15.7.en: Let the Buddha give a further [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk on the subject of past lives. The mendicants will listen and remember it.”

dn14:3.1.8.pli: Ahañceva kho pana [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseyyaṁ, pare ca me na ājāneyyuṁ; so mamassa kilamatho, sā mamassa vihesā’ti.
dn14:3.1.8.en: And if I were to teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, others might not understand me, which would be wearying and troublesome for me.’

dn14:3.2.10.pli: Itiha, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa paṭisañcikkhato appossukkatāya cittaṁ nami, no [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanāya.
dn14:3.2.10.en: So, as the Buddha Vipassī reflected like this, his mind inclined to remaining passive, not to teaching the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

dn14:3.2.12.pli: ‘nassati vata bho loko, vinassati vata bho loko, yatra hi nāma vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa appossukkatāya cittaṁ namati, no [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanāyā’ti.
dn14:3.2.12.en: ‘Oh my goodness! The world will be lost, the world will perish! For the mind of the Realized One Vipassī, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, inclines to remaining passive, not to teaching the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.’

dn14:3.3.2.en: ‘Sir, let the Blessed One teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m! Let the Holy One teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m!

dn14:3.4.9.pli: Ahañceva kho pana [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseyyaṁ, pare ca me na ājāneyyuṁ; so mamassa kilamatho, sā mamassa vihesā”ti.
dn14:3.4.9.en: “If I were to teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, others might not understand me, which would be wearying and troublesome for me.”

dn14:3.4.19.pli: Itiha me, brahme, paṭisañcikkhato appossukkatāya cittaṁ nami, no [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanāyā’ti.
dn14:3.4.19.en: So, as I reflected like this, my mind inclined to remaining passive, not to teaching the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.’

dn14:3.7.10.en: Let the Blessed One teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m!

dn14:3.7.17.pli: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā: ‘katāvakāso khomhi vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanāyā’ti vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tattheva antaradhāyi.
dn14:3.7.17.en: Then the Great Brahmā, knowing that his request for the Buddha Vipassī to teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m had been granted, bowed and respectfully circled him, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.

dn14:3.11.6.pli: evameva khaṇḍassa ca rājaputtassa tissassa ca purohitaputtassa tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakkhuṁ udapādi:
dn14:3.11.6.en: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m arose in the king’s son Khaṇḍa and the high priest’s son Tissa:

dn14:3.12.1.pli: Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
dn14:3.12.1.en: They saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m. They went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions. They said to the Buddha Vipassī,

dn14:3.13.2.pli: Te vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi;
dn14:3.13.2.en: Then the Buddha Vipassī educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

dn14:3.15.6.pli: evameva tesaṁ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṁ tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakkhuṁ udapādi:
dn14:3.15.6.en: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m arose in those 84,000 people:

dn14:3.16.1.pli: Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
dn14:3.16.1.en: They saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m. They went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions. They said to the Buddha Vipassī,

dn14:3.18.2.pli: ‘vipassī kira bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ anuppatto kheme migadāye viharati, [38;5;121mdhamma[0mñca kira desetī’ti.
dn14:3.18.2.en: ‘It seems the Blessed One Vipassī, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, has arrived at Bandhumatī and is staying in the deer park named Sanctuary. And he is teaching the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m!’

dn14:3.18.3.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, tāni caturāsītipabbajitasahassāni yena bandhumatī rājadhānī yena khemo migadāyo yena vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
dn14:3.18.3.en: Then they too went to see the Buddha Vipassī, realized the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, went forth, and became freed from defilements.

dn14:3.22.6.pli: desetha, bhikkhave, [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
dn14:3.22.6.en: Teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

dn14:3.26.3.pli: desetha, bhikkhave, [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
dn14:3.26.3.en: Teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

dn14:3.29.18.pli: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi evaṁ pabbajjā evaṁ padhānaṁ evaṁ abhisambodhi evaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakkappavattanaṁ.
dn14:3.29.18.en: And such was his renunciation, such his going forth, such his striving, such his awakening, and such his rolling forth of the wheel of [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

dn14:3.30.13.pli: Bhagavato, mārisā, evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi evaṁ pabbajjā evaṁ padhānaṁ evaṁ abhisambodhi evaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakkappavattanaṁ.
dn14:3.30.13.en: And such was your renunciation, such your going forth, such your striving, such your awakening, and such your rolling forth of the wheel of [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

dn16:1.12.1.pli: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharanto gijjhakūṭe pabbate etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:1.12.1.en: And while staying there at the Vulture’s Peak the Buddha often gave this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk to the mendicants:

dn16:1.14.2.pli: Tatrāpi sudaṁ bhagavā ambalaṭṭhikāyaṁ viharanto rājāgārake etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:1.14.2.en: And while staying there, too, he often gave this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk to the mendicants:

dn16:1.18.1.pli: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā nāḷandāyaṁ viharanto pāvārikambavane etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:1.18.1.en: And while staying at Nāḷandā, too, the Buddha often gave this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk to the mendicants:

dn16:1.25.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pāṭaligāmike upāsake bahudeva rattiṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uyyojesi:
dn16:1.25.1.en: The Buddha spent most of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the lay followers of Pāṭaligāma with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk. Then he dismissed them,

dn16:2.4.1.pli: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā koṭigāme viharanto etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:2.4.1.en: And while staying at Koṭigāma, too, the Buddha often gave this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk to the mendicants:

dn16:2.8.3.pli: Tasmātihānanda, dhammādāsaṁ nāma [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpariyāyaṁ desessāmi, yena samannāgato ariyasāvako ākaṅkhamāno attanāva attānaṁ byākareyya:
dn16:2.8.3.en: So Ānanda, I will teach you the explanation of the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m called ‘the mirror of the teaching’. A noble disciple who has this may declare of themselves:

dn16:2.10.1.pli: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā nātike viharanto giñjakāvasathe etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:2.10.1.en: And while staying there in Nādika the Buddha often gave this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk to the mendicants:

dn16:2.14.4.pli: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho ambapāliṁ gaṇikaṁ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
dn16:2.14.4.en: The Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired her with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

dn16:2.18.2.pli: Ekamantaṁ nisinne kho te licchavī bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
dn16:2.18.2.en: and the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

dn16:2.19.9.pli: Atha kho bhagavā ambapāliṁ gaṇikaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
dn16:2.19.9.en: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired her with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk, after which he got up from his seat and left.

dn16:2.20.1.pli: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā vesāliyaṁ viharanto ambapālivane etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:2.20.1.en: And while staying at Vesālī, too, the Buddha often gave this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk to the mendicants:

dn16:2.25.2.pli: Desito, ānanda, mayā dhammo anantaraṁ abāhiraṁ karitvā.
dn16:2.25.2.en: I’ve taught the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m without making any distinction between secret and public teachings.

dn16:3.18.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, ānanda, yadā tathāgato anuttaraṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakkaṁ pavatteti, tadāyaṁ pathavī kampati saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati.
dn16:3.18.1.en: Furthermore, when the Realized One rolls forth the supreme Wheel of [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.

dn16:3.22.4.pli: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassemi samādapemi samuttejemi sampahaṁsemi.
dn16:3.22.4.en: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

dn16:3.22.7.pli: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā antaradhāyāmi.
dn16:3.22.7.en: And when my [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk was finished I vanished.

dn16:3.23.11.pli: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassemi samādapemi samuttejemi sampahaṁsemi.
dn16:3.23.11.en: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

dn16:3.23.14.pli: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā antaradhāyāmi.
dn16:3.23.14.en: And when my [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk was finished I vanished.

dn16:4.4.1.pli: Tatrāpi sudaṁ bhagavā bhaṇḍagāme viharanto etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:4.4.1.en: And while staying there, too, he often gave this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk to the mendicants:

dn16:4.12.1.pli: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā bhoganagare viharanto ānande cetiye etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:4.12.1.en: And while staying at the Ānanda shrine, too, the Buddha often gave this [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk to the mendicants:

dn16:4.14.3.pli: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho cundaṁ kammāraputtaṁ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
dn16:4.14.3.en: The Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired him with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

dn16:4.19.5.pli: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho cundaṁ kammāraputtaṁ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
dn16:4.19.5.en: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired him with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk, after which he got up from his seat and left.

dn16:4.36.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pukkusaṁ mallaputtaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
dn16:4.36.1.en: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired Pukkusa the Malla with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk,

dn16:5.8.5.pli: ‘Idha tathāgatena anuttaraṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakkaṁ pavattitan’ti, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyaṁ saṁvejanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ.
dn16:5.8.5.en: Thinking: ‘Here the supreme Wheel of [38;5;121mDhamma[0m was rolled forth by the Realized One!’—that is an inspiring place.

dn16:5.8.9.pli: ‘idha tathāgato jāto’tipi, ‘idha tathāgato anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddho’tipi, ‘idha tathāgatena anuttaraṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakkaṁ pavattitan’tipi, ‘idha tathāgato anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbuto’tipi.
dn16:5.8.9.en: ‘Here the Realized One was born!’ and ‘Here the Realized One became awakened as a supreme fully awakened Buddha!’ and ‘Here the supreme Wheel of [38;5;121mDhamma[0m was rolled forth by the Realized One!’ and ‘Here the Realized One became fully extinguished through the natural principle of extinguishment, without anything left over!’

dn16:6.11.14.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca ānando taṁ rattāvasesaṁ dhammiyā kathāya vītināmesuṁ.
dn16:6.11.14.en: Ānanda and Anuruddha spent the rest of the night talking about [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

mn139:3.4.pli: ussādanañca ñatvā apasādanañca ñatvā nevussādeyya, na apasādeyya, [38;5;121mdhamma[0mmeva deseyya.
mn139:3.4.en: Knowing these, avoid them, and just teach [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

mn139:6.2.pli: ussādanañca ñatvā apasādanañca ñatvā nevussādeyya, na apasādeyya, [38;5;121mdhamma[0mmeva deseyyā’ti—
mn139:6.2.en: Knowing these, avoid them, and just teach [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.’

mn139:7.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, ussādanā ca hoti apasādanā ca, no ca [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanā?
mn139:7.1.en: And how is there flattering and rebuking without teaching [38;5;121mDhamma[0m?

mn139:7.14.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ussādanā ca hoti apasādanā ca, no ca [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanā.
mn139:7.14.en: That’s how there is flattering and rebuking without teaching [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

mn139:8.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, nevussādanā hoti na apasādanā, [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanā ca?
mn139:8.1.en: And how is there neither flattering nor rebuking, and just teaching [38;5;121mDhamma[0m?

mn139:8.3.en: Rather, by saying this you just teach [38;5;121mDhamma[0m:

mn139:8.8.en: Rather, by saying this you just teach [38;5;121mDhamma[0m:

mn139:8.13.en: Rather, by saying this you just teach [38;5;121mDhamma[0m:

mn139:8.18.en: Rather, by saying this you just teach [38;5;121mDhamma[0m:

mn139:8.23.en: Rather, by saying this you just teach [38;5;121mDhamma[0m:

mn139:8.27.en: Rather, by saying this you just teach [38;5;121mDhamma[0m:

mn139:8.30.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, nevussādanā hoti na apasādanā, [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanā ca.
mn139:8.30.en: That’s how there is neither flattering nor rebuking, and just teaching [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

mn139:8.32.pli: ussādanañca ñatvā apasādanañca ñatvā nevussādeyya, na apasādeyya, [38;5;121mdhamma[0mmeva deseyyā’ti—
mn139:8.32.en: Knowing these, avoid them, and just teach [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.’

mn139:13.16.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yāyaṁ ussādanā ca apasādanā ca no ca [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanā, sadukkho eso dhammo saupaghāto saupāyāso sapariḷāho;
mn139:13.16.en: Flattering and rebuking without teaching [38;5;121mDhamma[0m is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.

mn139:13.19.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yāyaṁ nevussādanā ca na apasādanā ca [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanā ca, adukkho eso dhammo anupaghāto anupāyāso apariḷāho;
mn139:13.19.en: Neither flattering nor rebuking, and just teaching [38;5;121mDhamma[0m is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.

an3.61:9.1.pli: Ayaṁ kho pana, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi.
an3.61:9.1.en: But the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m that I’ve taught is irrefutable, uncorrupted, beyond reproach, and not scorned by sensible ascetics and brahmins.

an3.61:9.2.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi?
an3.61:9.2.en: What is the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m that I’ve taught?

an3.61:9.3.pli: Imā cha dhātuyoti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi.
an3.61:9.3.en: ‘These are the six elements’: this is the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m I’ve taught …

an3.61:9.4.pli: Imāni cha phassāyatanānīti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi.

mn26:2.3.pli: “cirassutā no, āvuso ānanda, bhagavato sammukhā dhammī kathā.
mn26:2.3.en: “Reverend, it’s been a long time since we’ve heard a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk from the Buddha.

mn26:2.4.pli: Sādhu mayaṁ, āvuso ānanda, labheyyāma bhagavato sammukhā dhammiṁ kathaṁ savanāyā”ti.
mn26:2.4.en: It would be good if we got to hear a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk from the Buddha.”

mn26:2.6.pli: appeva nāma labheyyātha bhagavato sammukhā dhammiṁ kathaṁ savanāyā”ti.
mn26:2.6.en: Hopefully you’ll get to hear a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk from the Buddha.”

mn26:19.6.pli: Ahañceva kho pana [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseyyaṁ, pare ca me na ājāneyyuṁ, so mamassa kilamatho, sā mamassa vihesā’ti.
mn26:19.6.en: And if I were to teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, others might not understand me, which would be wearying and troublesome for me.’

mn26:19.16.pli: Itiha me, bhikkhave, paṭisañcikkhato appossukkatāya cittaṁ namati, no [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanāya.
mn26:19.16.en: So, as I reflected like this, my mind inclined to remaining passive, not to teaching the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

mn26:20.2.pli: ‘nassati vata bho loko, vinassati vata bho loko, yatra hi nāma tathāgatassa arahato sammāsambuddhassa appossukkatāya cittaṁ namati, no [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanāyā’ti.
mn26:20.2.en: ‘Oh my goodness! The world will be lost, the world will perish! For the mind of the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, inclines to remaining passive, not to teaching the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.’

mn26:20.5.en: ‘Sir, let the Blessed One teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m! Let the Holy One teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m!

mn26:20.22.en: Let the Blessed One teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m!

mn26:21.10.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmā sahampati ‘katāvakāso khomhi bhagavatā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanāyā’ti maṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tatthevantaradhāyi.
mn26:21.10.en: Then Brahmā Sahampati, knowing that his request for me to teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m had been granted, bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right, before vanishing right there.

dn34:1.6.78.pli: idhāvuso, bhikkhuno satthā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī.
dn34:1.6.78.en: Firstly, the Teacher or a respected spiritual companion teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to a mendicant.

dn34:1.6.79.pli: Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhuno satthā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpaṭisaṁvedī ca.
dn34:1.6.79.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, no matter how the Teacher or a respected spiritual companion teaches it.

dn34:1.6.82.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, api ca kho yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti
dn34:1.6.82.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor a respected spiritual companion teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to a mendicant. But the mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.

dn34:1.6.83.pli: yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhu yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpaṭisaṁvedī ca.
dn34:1.6.83.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, no matter how they teach it in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.

dn34:1.6.86.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti. Api ca kho yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ vitthārena sajjhāyaṁ karoti.
dn34:1.6.86.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor … the mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m. But the mendicant recites the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.

dn34:1.6.87.pli: Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhu yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ vitthārena sajjhāyaṁ karoti tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpaṭisaṁvedī ca.
dn34:1.6.87.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, no matter how they recite it in detail as they learned and memorized it.

dn34:1.6.90.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ vitthārena sajjhāyaṁ karoti.
dn34:1.6.90.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor … the mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m … nor does the mendicant recite the teaching.

dn34:1.6.92.pli: Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhu yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ cetasā anuvitakketi anuvicāreti manasānupekkhati tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpaṭisaṁvedī ca.
dn34:1.6.92.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, no matter how they think about and consider it in their heart, examining it with the mind as they learned and memorized it.

dn34:1.6.95.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ vitthārena sajjhāyaṁ karoti, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ cetasā anuvitakketi anuvicāreti manasānupekkhati;
dn34:1.6.95.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor … the mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m … nor does the mendicant recite the teaching … or think about it.

dn34:1.6.97.pli: Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhuno aññataraṁ samādhinimittaṁ suggahitaṁ hoti sumanasikataṁ sūpadhāritaṁ suppaṭividdhaṁ paññāya tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti [38;5;121mdhamma[0mppaṭisaṁvedī ca.
dn34:1.6.97.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, no matter how a meditation subject as a foundation of immersion is properly grasped, attended, borne in mind, and comprehended with wisdom.

dn34:2.1.123.pli: Idhāvuso, tathāgato ca loke uppanno hoti arahaṁ sammāsambuddho, dhammo ca desiyati opasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito.
dn34:2.1.123.en: Firstly, a Realized One has arisen in the world. He teaches the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One.

dn34:2.1.146.pli: ayañca puggalo majjhimesu janapadesu paccājāto hoti, so ca hoti paññavā ajaḷo aneḷamūgo, paṭibalo subhāsitadubbhāsitānamatthamaññātuṁ.
dn34:2.1.146.en: But he doesn’t teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as announced by the Holy One. And a person is reborn in a central country. And they’re wise, bright, clever, and able to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.

an5.26:4.1.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor … the mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m. But the mendicant recites the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.

an5.26:4.2.pli: Yathā yathā, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ vitthārena sajjhāyaṁ karoti tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthapaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpaṭisaṁvedī ca.
an5.26:4.2.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, no matter how they recite it in detail as they learned and memorized it.

an5.26:5.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ vitthārena sajjhāyaṁ karoti;
an5.26:5.1.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor … the mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m … nor does the mendicant recite the teaching.

an5.26:5.3.pli: Yathā yathā, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ cetasā anuvitakketi anuvicāreti manasānupekkhati tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthapaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpaṭisaṁvedī ca.
an5.26:5.3.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, no matter how they think about and consider it in their heart, examining it with the mind as they learned and memorized it.

an5.26:6.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ vitthārena sajjhāyaṁ karoti, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ cetasā anuvitakketi anuvicāreti manasānupekkhati;
an5.26:6.1.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor … the mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m … nor does the mendicant recite the teaching … or think about it.

an5.26:6.3.pli: Yathā yathā, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno aññataraṁ samādhinimittaṁ suggahitaṁ hoti sumanasikataṁ sūpadhāritaṁ suppaṭividdhaṁ paññāya tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthapaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpaṭisaṁvedī ca.
an5.26:6.3.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, no matter how a meditation subject as a foundation of immersion is properly grasped, attended, borne in mind, and comprehended with wisdom.

an9.4:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā nandako upaṭṭhānasālāyaṁ bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṁseti.
an9.4:1.2.en: Now at that time Venerable Nandaka was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants in the assembly hall with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

an9.4:4.3.pli: Etaṁ kho, nandaka, tumhākaṁ patirūpaṁ kulaputtānaṁ saddhāya agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitānaṁ, yaṁ tumhe dhammiyā kathāya sannisīdeyyātha.
an9.4:4.3.en: It’s appropriate for gentlemen like you, who have gone forth in faith from the lay life to homelessness, to sit together for a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

an9.4:9.3.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
an9.4:9.3.en: Firstly, a mendicant teaches the mendicants the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And they reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

an9.4:10.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti. Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ …pe…
an9.4:10.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant teaches the mendicants the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m …

an9.4:10.2.pli: brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti [38;5;121mdhamma[0mppaṭisaṁvedī ca.
an9.4:10.2.en: Whenever they do this, they feel inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

an9.4:11.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
an9.4:11.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant teaches the mendicants the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m …

an9.4:11.2.pli: Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ …pe… brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme gambhīraṁ atthapadaṁ paññāya ativijjha passati.
an9.4:11.2.en: Whenever they do this, they see the meaning of a deep saying in that [38;5;121mDhamma[0m with penetrating wisdom.

an9.4:12.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ …pe… brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
an9.4:12.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant teaches the mendicants the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m …

an9.4:13.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
an9.4:13.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant teaches the mendicants the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m …

mn91:17.3.pli: aññadatthu dhammiyā kathāya taṁ parisaṁ sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṁseti.
mn91:17.3.en: Invariably, he educates, encourages, fires up, and inspires that assembly with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

mn91:21.1.pli: So ārāmagato parisati [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, na taṁ parisaṁ ussādeti, na taṁ parisaṁ apasādeti;
mn91:21.1.en: In the monastery when he teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to an assembly, he neither flatters them nor rebukes them.

mn91:21.2.pli: aññadatthu dhammiyā kathāya taṁ parisaṁ sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṁseti.
mn91:21.2.en: Invariably, he educates, encourages, fires up, and inspires that assembly with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.

mn91:21.6.pli: Te tena bhotā gotamena dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṁsitā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamanti avalokayamānāyeva avijahitattā.
mn91:21.6.en: And when they’ve been inspired with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk by Master Gotama they get up from their seats and leave looking back at him alone, and not forgetting their lesson.

mn91:22.1.pli: Addasāma kho mayaṁ, bho, taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ gacchantaṁ, addasāma ṭhitaṁ, addasāma antaragharaṁ pavisantaṁ, addasāma antaraghare nisinnaṁ tuṇhībhūtaṁ, addasāma antaraghare bhuñjantaṁ, addasāma bhuttāviṁ nisinnaṁ tuṇhībhūtaṁ, addasāma bhuttāviṁ anumodantaṁ, addasāma ārāmaṁ gacchantaṁ, addasāma ārāmagataṁ nisinnaṁ tuṇhībhūtaṁ, addasāma ārāmagataṁ parisati [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desentaṁ.
mn91:22.1.en: I have seen Master Gotama walking and standing; entering inhabited areas, and sitting and eating there; sitting silently after eating, and expressing appreciation; going to the monastery, sitting silently there, and teaching [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to an assembly there.

mn91:24.8.pli: So [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
mn91:24.8.en: He teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And he reveals a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

mn91:36.7.pli: evameva brahmāyussa brāhmaṇassa tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mcakkhuṁ udapādi:
mn91:36.7.en: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m arose in the brahmin Brahmāyu:

mn91:36.9.pli: Atha kho brahmāyu brāhmaṇo diṭṭhadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogāḷhadhammo tiṇṇavicikiccho vigatakathaṅkatho vesārajjappatto aparappaccayo satthusāsane bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
mn91:36.9.en: Then Brahmāyu saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m. He went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions. He said to the Buddha:

thag21.1:37.1.en: When the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m has been so well taught,

thag21.1:46.3.en: When we heard the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, we became confident—

dn33:1.4.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pāveyyake malle bahudeva rattiṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uyyojesi:
dn33:1.4.4.en: The Buddha spent most of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the Mallas with a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk. Then he dismissed them,

dn33:1.5.3.en: Give them some [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk as you feel inspired.

dn33:2.1.128.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhuno satthā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī.
dn33:2.1.128.en: Firstly, the Teacher or a respected spiritual companion teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to a mendicant.

dn33:2.1.129.pli: Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhuno satthā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthapaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpaṭisaṁvedī ca.
dn33:2.1.129.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, no matter how the Teacher or a respected spiritual companion teaches it.

dn33:2.1.132.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, api ca kho yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti …pe…
dn33:2.1.132.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor a respected spiritual companion teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to a mendicant. But the mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m in detail to others as they learned and memorized it. …

dn33:2.1.136.pli: Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhuno aññataraṁ samādhinimittaṁ suggahitaṁ hoti sumanasikataṁ sūpadhāritaṁ suppaṭividdhaṁ paññāya tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthapaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpaṭisaṁvedī ca.
dn33:2.1.136.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, no matter how a meditation subject as a foundation of immersion is properly grasped, attended, borne in mind, and comprehended with wisdom.

dn33:3.2.44.pli: Idhāvuso, tathāgato ca loke uppanno hoti arahaṁ sammāsambuddho, dhammo ca desiyati opasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito.
dn33:3.2.44.en: Firstly, a Realized One has arisen in the world. He teaches the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One.

dn33:3.2.70.pli: dhammo ca na desiyati opasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito. Ayañca puggalo majjhimesu janapadesu paccājāto hoti, so ca hoti paññavā ajaḷo aneḷamūgo, paṭibalo subhāsitadubbhāsitānamatthamaññātuṁ.
dn33:3.2.70.en: But he doesn’t teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One. And a person is reborn in a central country. And they’re wise, bright, clever, and able to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.

sn22.115:1.5.pli: “Rūpassa ce, bhikkhu, nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti ‘[38;5;121mdhamma[0mkathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn22.115:1.5.en: “Mendicant, if a mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding form, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on [38;5;121mDhamma[0m’.

sn22.115:1.8.en: If a mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m for disillusionment with feeling …

sn22.115:1.11.pli: viññāṇassa ce, bhikkhu, nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, ‘[38;5;121mdhamma[0mkathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn22.115:1.11.en: consciousness, for its fading away and cessation, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on [38;5;121mDhamma[0m’.

sn22.116:1.6.pli: “Rūpassa ce, bhikkhu, nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, ‘[38;5;121mdhamma[0mkathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn22.116:1.6.en: “Mendicant, if a mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding form, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on [38;5;121mDhamma[0m’.

sn22.116:1.9.en: If a mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m for disillusionment with feeling …

sn22.116:1.12.pli: viññāṇassa ce, bhikkhu, nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, ‘[38;5;121mdhamma[0mkathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn22.116:1.12.en: consciousness, for its fading away and cessation, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on [38;5;121mDhamma[0m’.

an5.159:1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī mahatiyā gihiparisāya parivuto [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desento nisinno hoti.
an5.159:1.3.en: Now, at that time Venerable Udāyī was sitting teaching [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.

an5.159:1.6.pli: “āyasmā, bhante, udāyī mahatiyā gihiparisāya parivuto [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desetī”ti.
an5.159:1.6.en: “Sir, Venerable Udāyī is teaching [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.”

an5.159:2.1.en: “Ānanda, it’s not easy to teach [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to others.

an5.159:2.2.pli: Paresaṁ, ānanda, [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desentena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṁ upaṭṭhāpetvā paresaṁ dhammo desetabbo.
an5.159:2.2.en: You should establish five things in yourself before teaching [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to others.

an5.159:2.4.en: You should teach [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to others thinking: ‘I will teach step by step.’ …

an5.159:2.9.pli: Na kho, ānanda, sukaraṁ paresaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desetuṁ.
an5.159:2.9.en: It’s not easy to teach [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to others.

an5.159:2.10.pli: Paresaṁ, ānanda, [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desentena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattaṁ upaṭṭhāpetvā paresaṁ dhammo desetabbo”ti.
an5.159:2.10.en: You should establish these five things in yourself before teaching [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to others.”

sn12.16:2.1.pli: “Jarāmaraṇassa ce bhikkhu nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, ‘[38;5;121mdhamma[0mkathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn12.16:2.1.en: “If a mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding old age and death, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on [38;5;121mDhamma[0m’.

sn12.16:3.1.en: If a mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m for disillusionment regarding rebirth …

sn12.16:3.11.pli: avijjāya ce bhikkhu nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, ‘[38;5;121mdhamma[0mkathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn12.16:3.11.en: If a mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding ignorance, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on [38;5;121mDhamma[0m’.

sn35.155:2.1.pli: “Cakkhussa ce, bhikkhu, nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, ‘[38;5;121mdhamma[0mkathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn35.155:2.1.en: “If a mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding the eye, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on [38;5;121mDhamma[0m’.

sn35.155:2.4.pli: jivhāya ce, bhikkhu, nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, ‘[38;5;121mdhamma[0mkathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya …pe…
sn35.155:2.4.en: If a mendicant teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m for disillusionment with the ear … nose … tongue … body …

sn35.155:2.5.pli: manassa ce, bhikkhu, nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, ‘[38;5;121mdhamma[0mkathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn35.155:2.5.en: mind, for its fading away and cessation, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on [38;5;121mDhamma[0m’.

sn42.7:2.2.pli: Tesāhaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desemi—ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ, sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsemi.
sn42.7:2.2.en: I teach them the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And I reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

sn42.7:2.6.pli: Tesaṁ pāhaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desemi—ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ, sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsemi.
sn42.7:2.6.en: I also teach them the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And I reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

sn42.7:2.10.pli: Tesaṁ pāhaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desemi—ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsemi.
sn42.7:2.10.en: I also teach them the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And I reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

sn42.7:4.2.pli: Tesāhaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desemi—ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsemi.
sn42.7:4.2.en: I teach them the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And I reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

sn6.1:4.1.en: And as the Buddha reflected like this, his mind inclined to remaining passive, not to teaching the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.

sn6.1:5.2.pli: “nassati vata bho loko, vinassati vata bho loko, yatra hi nāma tathāgatassa arahato sammāsambuddhassa appossukkatāya cittaṁ namati, no [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdesanāyā”ti.
sn6.1:5.2.en: “Oh my goodness! The world will be lost, the world will perish! For the mind of the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, inclines to remaining passive, not to teaching the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m.”

sn6.1:5.5.en: “Sir, let the Blessed One teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m! Let the Holy One teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m!

sn35.74:9.1.en: “Because I understand that the Buddha has not taught the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m merely for the sake of ethical purity.”

sn35.74:11.1.en: “I understand that the Buddha has taught the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m for the purpose of the fading away of greed.”

sn6.14:3.2.pli: ‘paṭibhātu, brāhmaṇa, taṁ brahmuno ca brahmaparisāya ca brahmapārisajjānañca dhammī kathā’ti.

sn6.14:3.5.en: ‘It’s incredible, it’s amazing! How on earth can a disciple teach [38;5;121mDhamma[0m in the presence of the Teacher?’

sn6.14:4.3.pli: acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, kathañhi nāma satthari sammukhībhūte sāvako [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desessatīti.

sn6.14:4.5.pli: ‘Evaṁ, bhante’ti kho, bhikkhave, abhibhū bhikkhu sikhissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa paṭissutvā dissamānenapi kāyena [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desesi, adissamānenapi kāyena [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desesi, dissamānenapi heṭṭhimena upaḍḍhakāyena adissamānena uparimena upaḍḍhakāyena [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desesi, dissamānenapi uparimena upaḍḍhakāyena adissamānena heṭṭhimena upaḍḍhakāyena [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desesi.
sn6.14:4.5.en: ‘Yes, sir,’ replied Abhibhū. Then he taught [38;5;121mDhamma[0m with his body visible; with his body invisible; with the lower half visible and the upper half invisible; and with the upper half visible and the lower half invisible.

mn44:1.3.pli: Atha kho visākho upāsako yena [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdinnā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdinnaṁ bhikkhuniṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho visākho upāsako [38;5;121mdhamma[0mdinnaṁ bhikkhuniṁ etadavoca:

mn44:30.4.en: “The nun [38;5;121mDhamma[0mdinnā is astute, Visākha, she has great wisdom.

an4.128:1.4.pli: sā tathāgatena anālaye dhamme desiyamāne sussūsati sotaṁ odahati aññā cittaṁ upaṭṭhapeti.
an4.128:1.4.en: Yet when a Realized One is teaching the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m of non-adherence, they want to listen, they lend an ear, and they apply their minds to understand it.

an4.128:3.2.en: Yet when a Realized One is teaching the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m of peace, they want to listen, they lend an ear, and they apply their minds to understand it.

sn21.3:3.8.en: That’s the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk I had together with the Buddha.”

sn35.75:5.1.pli: “Na khvāhaṁ, bhante, sīlavisuddhatthaṁ bhagavatā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desitaṁ ājānāmī”ti.
sn35.75:5.1.en: “Because I understand that the Buddha has not taught the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m merely for the sake of ethical purity.”

sn35.75:6.1.pli: “No ce kira tvaṁ, bhikkhu, sīlavisuddhatthaṁ mayā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desitaṁ ājānāsi, atha kimatthaṁ carahi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, mayā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desitaṁ ājānāsī”ti?
sn35.75:6.1.en: “If that is so, what exactly do you understand to be the purpose of teaching the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m?”

sn35.75:7.1.en: “I understand that the Buddha has taught the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m for the purpose of complete extinguishment by not grasping.”

sn35.75:8.2.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṁ, bhikkhu, anupādāparinibbānatthaṁ mayā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desitaṁ ājānāsi.
sn35.75:8.2.en: It’s good that you understand that I’ve taught the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m for the purpose of complete extinguishment by not grasping.

sn35.133:4.2.en: But when I asked him to preach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m he just said that there would be an occasion for that, and then he got up and left.”

an8.21:4.9.en: I saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m. I went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions.

an8.21:8.3.en: But if they don’t teach me the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, I teach them.

an8.29:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, tathāgato ca loke uppanno hoti arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā, dhammo ca desiyati opasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito;
an8.29:1.4.en: Firstly, a Realized One has arisen in the world—perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed. He teaches the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One.

an8.29:8.2.pli: Dhammo ca na desiyati opasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito. Ayañca puggalo majjhimesu janapadesu paccājāto hoti, so ca hoti paññavā ajaḷo aneḷamūgo paṭibalo subhāsitadubbhāsitassa atthamaññātuṁ.
an8.29:8.2.en: So he doesn’t teach the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One. And a person is reborn in a central country. And they’re wise, bright, clever, and able to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.

an8.29:10.4.pli: Dhammo ca desiyati opasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito. Ayañca puggalo majjhimesu janapadesu paccājāto hoti, so ca hoti paññavā ajaḷo aneḷamūgo paṭibalo subhāsitadubbhāsitassa atthamaññātuṁ.
an8.29:10.4.en: He teaches the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One. And a person is reborn in a central country. And they’re wise, bright, clever, and able to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.

an8.22:4.8.en: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m arose in me:

an8.22:4.10.pli: So kho ahaṁ, bhante, diṭṭhadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogāḷhadhammo tiṇṇavicikiccho vigatakathaṅkatho vesārajjappatto aparappaccayo satthusāsane tattheva buddhañca [38;5;121mdhamma[0mñca saṅghañca saraṇaṁ agamāsiṁ, brahmacariyapañcamāni ca sikkhāpadāni samādiyiṁ.
an8.22:4.10.en: I saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m. I went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions. Right there I went for refuge to the Buddha, his teaching, and the Saṅgha. And I undertook the five training rules with celibacy as the fifth.

an8.22:7.3.en: If that venerable teaches me the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m,

an8.22:7.5.en: But if they don’t teach me the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m, I teach them.

sn55.7:1.8.en: He teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And he reveals a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

sn55.7:2.4.pli: Tesaṁ no bhavaṁ gotamo amhākaṁ evaṅkāmānaṁ evaṁchandānaṁ evaṁadhippāyānaṁ tathā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desetu yathā mayaṁ puttasambādhasayanaṁ ajjhāvaseyyāma …pe… sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjeyyāmā”ti.
sn55.7:2.4.en: Given that we have such wishes, may the Buddha teach us the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m so that we may achieve them.”

sn55.7:4.1.en: “And what is the explanation of the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m that’s relevant to oneself?

sn22.1:4.4.pli: Alattha no ajja bhagavato sammukhā dhammiṁ kathaṁ savanāyā”ti?
sn22.1:4.4.en: Did you get to hear a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk in the Buddha’s presence today?”

sn22.1:5.2.pli: Idānāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya amatena abhisitto”ti.
sn22.1:5.2.en: Just now the Buddha anointed me with the deathless ambrosia of a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk.”

sn22.1:5.3.pli: “Yathā kathaṁ pana tvaṁ, gahapati, bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya amatena abhisitto”ti?
sn22.1:5.3.en: “But what kind of ambrosial [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk has the Buddha anointed you with?”

sn22.1:6.8.pli: Evaṁ khvāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya amatena abhisitto”ti.
sn22.1:6.8.en: “That’s the ambrosial [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk that the Buddha anointed me with.”

an4.191:2.6.pli: api ca kho bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto devaparisāyaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti.
an4.191:2.6.en: However, a mendicant with psychic powers, who has achieved mastery of the mind, teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to the assembly of gods.

an4.191:3.5.pli: Tassa tattha na heva kho sukhino [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpadā plavanti, napi bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto devaparisāyaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti;
an4.191:3.5.en: But passages of the teaching don’t come back to them when they’re happy, nor does a mendicant with psychic powers … teach [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to the assembly of gods.

an4.191:3.6.pli: api ca kho devaputto devaparisāyaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti.
an4.191:3.6.en: However, a god teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to the assembly of gods.

an4.191:4.5.pli: Tassa tattha na heva kho sukhino [38;5;121mdhamma[0mpadā plavanti, napi bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto devaparisāyaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti, napi devaputto devaparisāyaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseti;
an4.191:4.5.en: But passages of the teaching don’t come back to them when they’re happy, and neither a mendicant with psychic powers … nor a god teaches [38;5;121mDhamma[0m to the assembly of gods.

sn22.90:1.3.pli: “ovadantu maṁ āyasmanto therā, anusāsantu maṁ āyasmanto therā, karontu me āyasmanto therā dhammiṁ kathaṁ, yathāhaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ passeyyan”ti.
sn22.90:1.3.en: “May the venerable senior mendicants advise me and instruct me! May they give me a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk so that I can see the teaching!”

sn22.90:3.17.pli: Ko nu kho me tathā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ deseyya yathāhaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ passeyyan”ti.
sn22.90:3.17.en: Who can teach me the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m so that I can see the teaching?”

sn22.90:4.2.pli: “ayaṁ kho āyasmā ānando kosambiyaṁ viharati ghositārāme satthu ceva saṁvaṇṇito sambhāvito ca viññūnaṁ sabrahmacārīnaṁ, pahoti ca me āyasmā ānando tathā [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ desetuṁ yathāhaṁ [38;5;121mdhamma[0mṁ passeyyaṁ;
sn22.90:4.2.en: “The Venerable Ānanda is staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery. He’s praised by the Buddha and esteemed by his sensible spiritual companions. He’s quite capable of teaching me the [38;5;121mDhamma[0m so that I can see the teaching.

sn22.90:7.5.en: “May Venerable Ānanda advise me and instruct me! May he give me a [38;5;121mDhamma[0m talk so that I can see the teaching!”
